Class Gameplay

java.lang.Object
  Gameplay

public class Gameplay
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Aaron Goldberg Facilitates the back-end logic for a Minesweeper game. Displays the front-end on a Board

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

Gameplay

public Gameplay(int h,
                int w,
                Board board,
                int nob,
                Minesweeper m)
Create a new instance of Gameplay. Each instance is another Minesweeper game

Parameters:
h - the height of the board in squares
w - the width of the board in squares
board - the Board that displays the game to the user
nob - the number of bombs to put in the game
m - the Minseweeper object that creates the game
Method Detail

setUpInitialBombs

public void setUpInitialBombs(int nob)
Places the bombs on a grid

Parameters:
nob - the number of bombs to place

addBomb

public void addBomb()
Adds a bomb to the grid

setFlagsAsFalse

public void setFlagsAsFalse()
Sets all the squares as unflagged

setClickedAsFalse

public void setClickedAsFalse()
Sets all the squares as unclicked cells

checkIfWon

public boolean checkIfWon()
checks to see if the player has won the game

Returns:
true if the game was won, false if the user lost

buttonClicked

public void buttonClicked(int cell,
                          int type,
                          boolean firstClick)
If a cell was clicked, call this method which computes the actions that should occur both on the front-end and back-end

Parameters:
cell - the cell that was clicked
type - the type of click (Left, Right)
firstClick - was this the first click of the game?

moveBombs

public void moveBombs(int[] positions)
if the first click was a bomb, move it so that the first click is a 0

Parameters:
positions - the entire grid of cells in the form of a two-dimensional array

leftClick

public void leftClick(int[] positions)
Called when the user left-clicks

Parameters:
positions - that were clicked

leftClick

public void leftClick(int x,
                      int y)
Called when the user left-clicks

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate clicked
y - the y coordinate clicked

rightClick

public void rightClick(int[] positions)

doubleClick

public void doubleClick(int[] positions)
Called when the user double-clicks a cell, clicks all the cells around it if the number of adjacent bombs is equal to the number of adjacent flags

Parameters:
positions - the coordinates of the cell double clicked

clickAllAround

public void clickAllAround(int[] positions)
Clicks all around a specific cell

Parameters:
positions - the coordinates of the cell to click all around

findOutHowManyBombsAround

public int findOutHowManyBombsAround(int[] positions)
Finds out how many bombs are around a specific cell

Parameters:
positions - the coordinates of the cell to look around for bombs
Returns:
the number of bombs around that cell

findOutHowManyFlagsAround

public int findOutHowManyFlagsAround(int[] positions)
Finds out how many bombs surround a cell

Parameters:
positions - the coordinates of the cell to look around for flags
Returns:
the number of bombs around that cell

turnCellIDIntoPosition

public int[] turnCellIDIntoPosition(int cell)
turns a cell ID into the x and y coordinates of that cell

Parameters:
cell - the cell ID to convert
Returns:
an int array containing the x and y coordinates of the cell

convertBackToCellID

Parameters:
coordinates - the coordinates to turn into a cell ID
Returns:

Parameters:
